member.name: T:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationEventLogExtensions
member.summary: Adds the WriteTo.EventLog() extension method to .

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationEventLogExtensions.EventLog(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.IEventIdProvider)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events to the Windows event log.
member.param: The logger configuration.
The source name by which the application is registered on the local computer.
The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include Application, System, or a custom event log.
The name of the machine hosting the event log written to. The local machine by default.
If true, check/create event source as required. Defaults to false i.e. do not allow sink to manage event source creation.
A message template describing the format used to write to the sink. The default is "{Timestamp} [{Level}] {Message}{NewLine}{Exception}".
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
Supplies event ids for emitted log events.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationEventLogExtensions.EventLog(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,Serilog.Formatting.ITextFormatter,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.IEventIdProvider)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events to the Windows event log.
member.param: The logger configuration.
The source name by which the application is registered on the local computer.
The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include Application, System, or a custom event log.
The name of the machine hosting the event log written to. The local machine by default.
If false does not check/create event source. Defaults to true i.e. allow sink to manage event source creation
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
Formatter to control how events are rendered into the file. To control plain text formatting, use the overload that accepts an output template instead.
Supplies event ids for emitted log events.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.EventIdHashProvider
member.summary: Hash functions for message templates. See .

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.EventIdHashProvider.ComputeEventId(Serilog.Events.LogEvent)
member.summary: Computes an Event Id for the given log event.
member.param: The log event to compute the event id from.
member.returns: Computed event id based off the given log.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.EventIdHashProvider.Compute(System.String)
member.summary: Compute a 32-bit hash of the provided . The resulting hash value can be uses as an event id in lieu of transmitting the full template string.
member.param: A message template.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.EventLog.EventLogSink
member.summary: Writes log events as documents to the Windows event log.
member.remarks: Beware of changing the source/logname, see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/804284/how-do-i-write-to-a-custom-windows-event-log?rq=1

member.param: The source name by which the application is registered on the local computer.
The name of the log the source's entries are written to. Possible values include Application, System, or a custom event log.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
The name of the machine hosting the event log written to.
If false does not check/create event source. Defaults to true i.e. allow sink to manage event source creation
